mfi6:purpose_for_registry.mdr3:title: The United States Health Information Knowledgebase (USHIK) is an on-line, publicly accessible registry and repository of healthcare-related metadata, specifications, and standards. USHIK is funded and directed by the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ) with management support and engagement from numerous public and private partners.

organization.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

designation.sign: National Hospital Ambulatory Medical Care Survey 2013 Emergency Department Patient Record

section_instruction.mfi13:label: Assurance of confidentiality - All information which would permit identification of an individual, a practice, or an establishment will be held confidential; will be used for statistical purposes only by NCHS staff, contractors, and agents only when required and with necessary controls; and not be disclosed or released to other persons without the consent of the individual or establishment in accordance with section 308(d) of the Public Health Service Act (42 USC 242m) and the Confidential Information Protection and Statistical Efficiency Act (PL-107-347).

sdc:additional_instruction.label: ED departure, if released or transferred

item_prompt.label: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

sdc:list_item.value_meaning: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

sdc:question_prompt.label: Expected source(s) of payment for this visit
Has patient been seen in this ED within the last 72 hours and discharged?

sdc:section_title.label: Patient's complaint(s), symptom(s), or other reason(s) for this visit

item_prompt.label: Initial visit to this ED for problem

sdc:list_item.value_meaning: Initial visit to this ED for problem

item_prompt.label: Follow-up visit to this ED for problem

sdc:list_item.value_meaning: Follow-up visit to this ED for problem

sdc:question_prompt.label: Is this visit related to an injury, poisoning, or adverse effect of medical treatment?

item_prompt.label: Yes, adverse effect of medical treatment

sdc:question_prompt.label: Cause of injury, poisoning, or adverse effect -

sdc:additional_instruction.label: Describe the place and events that preceded the injury, poisoning, or adverse effect (e.g. allergy to penicillin, bee sting, pedestrian hit by car driven by drunk driver, spouse beaten with fists by spouse, heroin overdose, infected shunt, etc.). Do not enter proper names of people or places. For motor vehicle crash, indicate if occured on the street or highway versus a driveway or parking lot.

sdc:section_instruction.label: As specifically as possible, list diagnoses related to this visit including chronic conditions.

item_prompt.label: Cerebrovascular disease/ History of stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA)
History of pulmonary embolism or deep vein thrombosis (DVT)

sdc:section_instruction.label: Mark (X) all ordered or provided at this visit.
Mark (X) all provided at this visit. Exclude medications
List up to 12 drugs given at this visit or prescribed at ED discharge. Include Rx and OTC drugs, immunizations, and anesthetics.

sdc:additional_instruction.label: Mark (X) all providers seen at this visit.

item_prompt.label: Admit to observation unit then hospitalized
Admit to observation unit, then discharged

sdc:section_instruction.label: Complete if the patient was admitted to this hospital at this ED visit. - Mark (X) "Unknown" in each item, if efforts have been exhausted to collect the data.

sdc:question_prompt.label: Date and time bed was requested for hospital admission
Date and time patient actually left the ED or observation unit

item_prompt.label: Transfer to another facility (not usual place of residence)

sdc:additional_text.label: Complete if the patient was admitted to this hospital at this ED visit. - Mark (X) "Unknown" in each item, if efforts have been exhausted to collect the data.
If this information is not available at the time of abstraction, then complete the Hospital Admission Log.

sdc:question_prompt.label: Date and time of observation unit discharge
